metadata.title: CVE-2023-20588 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
A division-by-zero error on some AMD processors can potentially returnspeculative data resulting in loss of confidentiality.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-20588` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-84-generic - 5.15.0-84.93
linux-image-5.15.0-84-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-84.93
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-84-generic - 5.15.0-84.93
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-84-generic-64k - 5.15.0-84.93
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1042-kvm - 5.15.0-1042.47
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-84.93').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1042.47').
linux-allwinner-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1045.50').
linux-aws-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-6.2, was needs-triage').
